alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued April 09 at 4:08AM EDT until April 11 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM EDT TUESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, significant coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves building 8 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone tonight and continuing through Monday night. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a strong southward flowing longshore current and a moderate risk of dangerous rip currents is expected. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 4 PM this afternoon to 4 AM EDT Tuesday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM EDT Tuesday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Coastal roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses and some critical infrastructure will be inundated. Significant shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The high tide of most concern will occur between 11 pm and 1130 pm tonight. The Volusia county coast is especially vulnerable to wave runup given the loss of dunes and sea walls as a result of Hurricanes Ian and Nicole last autumn.
info.instruction: Coastal flooding is expected with the next several high tide cycles. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. High surf will affect the beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. Swimmers should remain out of the water due to large breaking waves and dangerous surf conditions. Entering the surf is not advised.
